Yep, It's time to evaluate the imperfect characters.

I am going to start by throwing out part of my definition of a  
perfect character: a character that, no matter how much and experience 
and intelligence it has, can not continously perform attacks without 
using up magical energy.

Yep, I have used an archmage to summon images of characters that can't 
 use up their magical energy.  I even had elves in a forest who 
couldn't use up their magical energy unless time was frozen.  My 
answer is tying the amount of magical energy used for an attack to the 
total amount of magical energy available.

Soldier definitely fits this criteria of imperfection, but I am 
picking on it for another reason: given the exact same amount of 
magical energy, a thief can do more damage than a solder.  That's 
right, a solder is magic guzzler.  My answer to this dilemna is 
increase the amount of damage done per attack by a soldier.

A standard level 30 computer generated elf can walk through a forest 
without losing magical energy unless it engages in an attack.  Even 
then, once the attack is completed, it can recharge while in the 
forest.  Big deal, right?  wrong.  Think about it.  (I am going to 
wait 3-4 days before I expose the potential problem this creates to 
see if anyone else figures it out.)

Any more reviews of either the elf or the solder are welcome right 
now.
